newsitem.title: UK: LME base metals barely budge from kerb closes.
newsitem.headline: LME base metals barely budge from kerb closes.

text.p: Base metal prices on the London Metal Exchange (LME) barely budged in late inter-office trade on Tuesday, with only copper edging back slightly in slow trade.
Three month copper futures were indicated at $1,955/57 a tonne by 1800 GMT, down slightly from the afternoon kerb close of $1,960.
Traders said banks still appeared to be unwinding long positions formerly owned by Sumitomo Corp, keeping a lid on prices and thwarting bullish sentiment coming from sizeable stock drawdowns.
All other base metals were unchanged from the afternoon kerb closing levels. --London Newsroom +44 171 542 8057
